status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.section: PET/CT and MRI for multimodal image compatibility
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"buthr","text":"Preparation of eye bars and ear bars: With a syringe, fill the ear and eye bars with a small dose (0.05 MBq ear bar, 1.54 MBq eye bar) of [18F] fluorodeoxyglucose (FDG) and seal the chamber with a MRI-compatible nylon screw. Note that these doses are for proof of concept, and even smaller doses of a radioligand may suffice for practical use, depending on exposure and technical considerations.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2l98o","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f7q6j","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"d2s03","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"height":294,"id":459057,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":null,\"entityMap\":null}","mime":"image/png","originalFile":{},"original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/qajvcdamx.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/qajtcdamx.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/qajucdamx.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/qajscdamx.webp","width":307}}}}

steps.section: PET/CT and MRI for multimodal image compatibility
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6eki0","text":"PET Imaging: Place the ear and eye bars in a small preclinical PET/CT scanner (here we used the Si78; Bruker BioSpin GmbH, Ettlingen, Germany) and use the Paravision-360 software package (version 3.2; Bruker BioSpin Corp, Billerica, MA, RRID: SCR_001964) for image acquisition.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: PET/CT and MRI for multimodal image compatibility
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"4qg26","text":"CT Acquisition: Acquire a CT scan using the same PET/CT scanner equipped with a Low Dose 1 mm aluminum filter. Here we used a “step and shoot” method with a 0.6-degree gantry step for image acquisition.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: PET/CT and MRI for multimodal image compatibility
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"fi0al","text":"Image Reconstruction: Reconstruct the CT images using the filtered back projection algorithm.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
